clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Use of a Graded Infusion of Intravenous Glucose in the Assessment of Insulin Secretion Rates (MK-0000-078)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, 2-Period, Pilot Study in Healthy Male Subjects to Evaluate the Use of a Graded Infusion of Intravenous Glucose in the Assessment of Insulin Secretion Rates

brief_summary.textblock: A two period pilot study to determine if a graded glucose infusion using a glucose (20% dextrose [D20]) intravenous infusion can be properly implemented and will be well tolerated in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: proper implementation and tolerability of a grade glucose infusion using D20 intravenous infusion measured by glucose, insulin and C-peptide levels

secondary_outcome.measure: beta-cell glucose sensitivity (slope of the relationship between insulin secretion rate and glucose)

intervention.intervention_name: Comparator: graded infusion of intravenous glucose
intervention.description: A stepwise graded infusion of glucose (20% dextrose [D20]) with a stable rate of infusion maintained for 40 minutes for each of 5 steps, with steps at 2,4,6,8 and 12mg/kg/min. Procedure will be identical in Period 1 and Period 2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is in good health
- Subject is a non-smoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a history of hypertension requiring treatment
- Subject has a history of cancer
- Subject's parents of siblings have a history of type 2 diabetes
- Subject is unable to refrain from the use of any prescription or non-prescription medication
- Subject consumes excessive amounts of alcohol or caffeine
- Subject has had major surgery, donated blood or participated in another investigational study in the past 4 weeks
